election_record.label: Maryland 1801 Treasurer, Eastern Shore

sub_unit.name: General Assembly
sub_unit.note: "From Annapolis - To the Editor, December 3. The election of a Treasurer for the Eastern Shore, this day occupied the attention of the House: little time was required to ascertain that they had the right to remove the present one. They therefore proceeded to the ballot; a majority of the whole was requisite to constitute a choice. Mr. Chambers had 35 votes - Mr. Ginson 33. A new ballot is about taking place." American. And Baltimore Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). December 4, 1801.

election_record.reference: American. And Baltimore Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). December 4, 1801.
